page.title: 16HOUSING
page.content: roofs. The slate the older, tile for the more recently built houses. Thatched roofs are in evidence giving an aesthetic aspect to some of the older houses found in a linear form along S Molton St, E St, Leigh Rd and the roads about the parish church. The newer areas are the houses at Dartmoor View (built in the '60/70s), Land Park & Four Ways (numbering 60, built in the late '70/80s). These were built filling in space between Leigh Rd and S Molton St which both radiate from Fore St, the village centre. An attractive, individually built, new area in the SE is that near the cricket field. The sizable walled residence, the Rectory, is in itself a recent history of Chulmleigh. The occasional three storied house is seen Almost all homes have a telephone, a garden and are on mains water. Rather
